_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Facility:  Cooperative Exchange - Barnes City
Contact: Marv Freeborn
Phone:   641-644-5122    

1. Facility Policy 
    
    The owners, management and employees of Sully Cooperative Exchange - Barnes City are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the Barnes City fire department, Mahahaka County LEPC, and/or other authorities, to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the people and the environment.

2. Facility Information
    
    The primary activity at the facility is the distribution of products to farmers. The fertilizer product, anhydrous ammonia, is received, stored and distributed for direct application as a nutrient for crop production. Anhydrous ammonia is stored in tanks designed for this purpose.

3. The Worst-Case Release Scenario and the Alternate Release Scenario
    
    An analysis of the potential off-site consequences of hypothetical worst-case and alternative-case accidental releases have been addressed in our Hazard Assessment and information is in our Risk Management Program.

    4. Accidental Release Prevention Program 
        
        The facility is in compliance with the provisions of the U.S. (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and     Handling     of Anhydrous Ammonia" and our state regulations covering anhydrous ammonia. The OSHA Standard     is referenced in this RMP Registration Form; see Section 8.3.(b).
5.    Five-Year Accident History 
        There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge have there been any accidental releases resulting in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuation, property damage, or environmental damage.
6.    Emergency Action Plan
    The facility has:
    a. A written Emergency Action Plan, in accordance with OSHA Standard 29 CFR 1910.38;
    b. Provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning a

nd Community right-to-    know information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA);
    c. If a large release of anhydrous ammonia takes place at the facility, the required response action is     to evacuate the area of the spill and call 911 and all applicable emergency response numbers listed     in our Emergency Action Plan.
7.    Planned Changes to Improve Safety
    Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility. Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the conditions of Cooperative Exchange - Barnes City. There are no additional specific safety recommendations regarding storage or use of anhydrous ammonia for implementation at this time.
